metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4900 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in PHP where setting the environment variable PHP_CLI_SERVER_WORKERS to a large value leads to a heap buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
php8.1 - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4
php8.1-bz2 - 8.1.12-1ubuntu4

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial leosilva> php7.2 in bionic and 7.4 in focal hasn't code affected. rodrigo-zaiden> affected code seems like was added in commit 82effb3f, that is included with php7.4.

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.12-1ubuntu4').
